intro: Bikkia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Bikkia tetrandra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
